item.title: Empress add a quote by Khaela Maricich (a.k.a. The Blow)
item.description: "If something in the deli aisle makes you cry, of course I'll put my arm around you and I'll walk you outside." -- Khaela Maricich (a.k.a. The Blow)

item.title: Empress add a quote by Tracy Morgan
item.description: "Live every week like it's shark week." -- Tracy Morgan

item.title: Empress add a quote by bell hooks
item.description: "One of the most subversive institutions in the United States is the public library.." -- bell hooks

item.title: Empress add a quote by bell hooks
item.description: "I grew up in the midst of poverty but every black kid that I knew could read and write. We have to talk about the fact that we cannot educate for critical consciousness if we have a group of people who cannot access Fanon, Cabral, or Audre Lorde because they can’t read or write. How did Malcolm X radicalize his consciousness? He did it through books. If you deprive working-class and poor black people of access to reading and writing, you are making them that much farther removed from being a class that can engage in revolutionary resistance." -- bell hooks

item.title: Empress add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I never teach my pupils, I only attempt to provide the conditions in which they can learn." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Empress add a quote by Siva Vaidhyanathan
item.description: "Real education happens only by failing, changing, challenging, and adjusting. All of those gerunds apply to teachers as well as students. No person is an “educator,” because education is not something one person does to another. Education is an imprecise process, a dance, and a collaborative experience." -- Siva Vaidhyanathan
